intro: Rindera lanata var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy rindera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, pubescent stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as woodland floors or stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late spring to early summer. The species is notable for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to its habitat.
